summary: Completed comprehensive testing of drag and drop and paste (Ctrl+V) functionality for image upload. All core features working perfectly including visual overlay, image capture, preview, and GPT-5.1 vision integration.

ui_bugs.issue: Frontend accepts non-image files in file input, though backend properly validates and rejects them
ui_bugs.impact: Minor UX issue - backend validation prevents actual upload of non-image files

passed_tests: Backend API root endpoint (/api/) - 200 OK
Text chat endpoint (/api/chat) with GPT-5.1 - Portuguese responses
Image analysis endpoint (/api/chat/image) - accepts multipart/form-data
Image file validation - backend correctly rejects non-image files
GPT-5.1 vision integration working with all upload methods
Drag overlay appears on dragover event with correct Portuguese text
Drag overlay disappears on dragleave event
Drag and drop image capture and preview functionality
Paste (Ctrl+V) image capture and preview functionality
Upload button image capture and preview functionality
Clear image button works for all upload methods
Image preview displays correctly for all upload methods
All upload methods (button/drag/paste) work equally
GPT-5.1 vision analysis works after drag/drop upload
GPT-5.1 vision analysis works after paste upload
GPT-5.1 vision analysis works after button upload
Portuguese language support in AI image analysis responses
Welcome screen displays drag/paste tip message correctly
Neural void design maintained with drag/drop overlay
Drag overlay has proper styling with pulse animation
Image messages saved to MongoDB with image_url field
Message persistence working for all upload methods
Typing indicator appears during AI image processing
User messages display uploaded images correctly
AI messages provide detailed Portuguese image analysis

success_percentage.frontend: 96% (24/25 tests passed - minor file validation UX issue)
success_percentage.design: 100% (neural void design maintained with new overlay)
